column4: Hey there Ubuntu users.  I know this is probably a busy time, but I've got a wireless disconnect.  It worked in gutsy and not in hardy, any ideas or related problems?
- broadcom?
- no, it's your hardware.  there shoujld be a restricted devices manager up top?
with the icons for battery, network etc..?
- yes, and if its not there its under system- admin - hardware drivers
- hopefully its just you need a driver
No proprietary drivers are in use on this system.  isn't that an oddity?
- that's actually a good thing, but the bad thing is if it doesn't suggest for you to, which may have been the problem
it doesn't suggest any sort of driver.  on a notebook with touchpad working well, audio is terrible, and wireless down
it can discover all available networks, just not connect and windows still can
- use lspci to figure out what you ahve
it must be using the hardware to discover multiple wireless networks, right?
- yeah it's not a driver problem... have you tired moving closer to the router?
vista connects with no difficulty at all, it's a well repeated network around a campus
http://paste.ubuntu.com/8618/
looks like 3945ABG
- just for the record, is the LCD working
no, it's orange, blue is "working"
- that's bug #178530, and no known solution as of now.  Are you able to access "open" networks?
none are available to test with
- all i can say is either wait or subsribe to that bug report and try to help it get fixed, sorry
thanks for the help
- due to the nature of the bug, i'm pretty sure it'll be fixed shortly, as they are alrady making progress
- it's always a busy time right after a distro release
